issuetype.description: A user story. Created by JIRA Software - do not edit or delete.
issuetype.name: Story

fields.customfield_10372: By releasing this increment, we'll add the ability to configure items availability split logic on MFC level rather than having it on a global level (per environment) using ITEMS_AVAILABILITY_MFC config so that 'full', 'partial-full', or 'none' spit strategy can be set up per location-id

fixVersions.name: By releasing this increment, we'll add the ability to configure items availability split logic on MFC level rather than having it on a global level (per environment) using ITEMS_AVAILABILITY_MFC config so that 'full', 'partial-full', or 'none' spit strategy can be set up per location-id

fields.customfield_10372:
By releasing this increment, we will remove from codebase 4 feature flags used for ISPS 1.0 as clients get migrated to ISPS 2.0:
  - inv-1983-check-available-items-before-creating-pick-list 
  - inv-1984-isps-consider-oos-reg-items-too 
  - inv-2056-recalculate-delta-batch 
  - inv-2058-reg-items-should-be-grouped-by-aisle-number-if-available 
ISPS 2.0 has this logic embedded by default

fields.customfield_10372: In this release, orders that get canceled through TOM-UI or via our support team will send status updates through the integration channel” or something along those lines.

fields.customfield_10372:
This increment will provide the ability to switch from Service contracts to Order wave management by changing the TSC configuration. 
Additionally, it will impact order status change from Draft to Queued  immediately during manual Split avoiding being at status New until the cutoff time. 
Orders that were created according to SCS before deployment will have status change from Draft -> New -> Queued immediately at cutoff time
